summary: This bill, the Geothermal Ombudsman for National Deployment and Optimal Reviews Act, aims to streamline the geothermal permitting process within the Bureau of Land Management (BLM). It mandates the appointment of a Geothermal Ombudsman to act as a liaison, provide dispute resolution, monitor permit processing, develop best practices, and coordinate with the Federal Permitting Improvement Steering Council. The bill also establishes a Geothermal Permitting Task Force within the BLM, headed by the Ombudsman, with the authority to assign personnel and offer retention allowances to expedite permitting. An annual report on the Task Force's activities and permitting effectiveness is required.
